reviewText: This is one of those games I wish I could give a neutral opinion on. It's not inherently bad, yet it's not all that great. Allow me to explain, dear reader.\n\nPlanet 1138 is an Action/RTS game where you control a Command Buggy" that has rockets
recommended: a shield and nitrous that captures bases which then produce units and pushes them down the lane towards the enemy base. As the game goes on and you complete levels
hoursPlayed: you will unlock new upgrades which passively upgrade your buggy to deal more damage or to upgrade the turrets on support bases. Honestly
voteText: the game is more of a MOBA like Warshift than it is an Action/RTS like Battlezone or Uprising: Join or Die. There are a ton of levels to play through with super challenging AI and even multiplayer. Overall
votesHelpful: it works and it is competent.\n\nThis all sounds great right? Well
votesTotal: it's more meh than it is good. The core concept is amazing
votesFunny: I'm a huge fan of Uprising: Join or Die and I'd kill to have another one or at the very least an Action/RTS that operates in the same style but that is aside the point. Planet 1138 is meh because of presentation and the cheating nature of the AI opponent.\n\nPresentation you say? Well yes
commentsCount: unfortunately all the menus in the game look as though they were made in paint.NET and the game has the barest of aesthetic qualities. While this isn't bad in itself
column16: it makes the game look more like a first time flash game than an actual 9.99 Steam game. While this isn't meant to be a knock on the dev but I'd highly recommend they hire on someone who can redesign the menus or the interface in general. I truly believe that presentation is one of the most important qualities when designing anything and I'd love to see some more work put into the game's aesthetics.\n\nMy second problem? The AI is utter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Somehow he can lock on to you and shoot at you from every angle while you can only autoaim at opponent's directly in front of you. The AI isn't foolish enough to sit still and let you shoot at him
column17: he will drive circles around you and pummel you into the dirt. It causes the AI to be super aggressive while the player has to fight defensively by standing next to bases and such. This may just be me being a noob but it seems like the AI has a naturally unfair advantage in the game.\n\nIn conclusion
column19: not a great game. With some work
column20: I can see this being an amazing first attempt by the studio. For now
column21:
I can't recommend it at 9.99. I would at 5.99 though. Seems more reasonable of a price.

reviewText:
What we've got here is a gem of a game.
It seems like a simple shooter / simulator during training, but things quickly escalate. In the second mission you'll be capturing base after base while trying to defend your territory.
In the third mission you're battling over a whole battlefield of tanks vs tanks.
Planet 1138 is a great mix of action of tactics, and basically a lot of fun.
voteText: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is like a first person MOBA with tanks and buggies.
It all works together in a very nice and interesting way, making the player decide what strategy to adopt: support the drones, attack enemy drones or capture neutral bases.
The action is very fast, so the player must decide quickly what to do, which is good. No lagging here, action all the way.
Thumbs up for this.
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game has a good ideea. But that's it.
It is far from finished.

Pro: Rare type of game that merges shooters with rts .
Looks very mod-able

Cons: Lots of invisible textures - when you go near a ramp you might get stuck or just get randomly thrown up.
The AI is very basic. You can just sit in the back of a base and the enemy AI will just ignore you.
The shooting is.. weird. The AI controlled Buggy can shoot while running. You can only shoot straight(minigun).
The menu and overall game controls are definetly made and kept for a controller. The only transition are the keybindings.
Very few upgrades, that don't look like they might impact the game a lot even in the late levels. (didn't reach there tho)

Even if this game would be better, 10$? really? 2$ might be too much. 0.5$ maximum for it's current state.

Do not purchase this, some alpha state games are more complete than this. Even EA games have more content.

reviewText: Should be an Early Access title because of all the glitches.  Collision detection messes up a lot and the AI is really bad.  It's also incredibly basic.  Maybe if they spent some time fleshing it out it would be ok but right now it feels more like a phone game.\n\nGo play Battlezone instead.  I think that game came out in the 90s haha

reviewText: Planet 1138 is like Mario Kart or Twisted Metal for the PC.  Reminds me of the old days of playing it on my super nintendo and N64.  This game is a lot of fun and enjoyable for hours.  I highly recommend this for anyone who likes car games and shooting and blowing up stuff. Very fun game!

reviewText: This game is an amazing one on one war. Combines RTS elements and MOBA elements to create a great, difficult, strategic battle. The computer has a fair difficulty, and online you will lose... to me. Bring it.

reviewText:
So I was hopeful for this little game but very quickly let down.

There just doesn't seem to be much point to the player being on the battlefield.  Tactics just really aren't there.
Terrain does not offer cover...so there isn't much in the way of strategy.  You pick up ammo and repair like some sort of old racing game.  Unless your opponent has really terrible aim you essentially are just trading blows....

If the player vehicle had a drone mode I doubt you could ever perform better than it....

I do not recommend this game.

reviewText:
This is easily the best game of 2016 so far, but it will have tough competition. This game reminds me a lot of the classic PC game Battlezone which I loved. It was recently announced that they are remaking the original Battlezone for Steam with an expected release date of Spring 2016 and that game might beat it, but for now it's my favorite new game on Steam.

Link to Battlezone game:

http://store.steampowered.com/app/301650/

reviewText: This game Rocks! Ive been playing it a ton since I found it on steam. I love the way its a totally even battle so who ever plays better will win (allmost no luck involved) its like live action chess with cool fighting. I find myself thinking of strategies for all the different maps (n theres alot of them) whenever im not playing it. you know a game is good when you think about when your not playing it. lol ive played alot and I dont think any battle ever even played out the same way. I highly recommend this game! if you like strategy try it, you Will like it.

reviewText: A very challenging MOBA. I enjoyed playing this game for a good while. I like how each stage gets more challenging and think its pretty good considering the price. I ran into a few glitches but overall it worked fairly good to where I still enjoyed it. I definately recommend this game to any person who wants a different MOBA game to play with for a couple of hours or longer on multiplayer.

Pros:

Very deep strategy.

Unique and fun.

Tons of maps. Each one plays very differently from the rest and requires new thinking.

It's blend of action, moba, and rts that works surprisingly well.

Cons:

Very hard to find matches online. This game would be way better if more people played it.

Tutorial is lacking.

Graphics are okay but nothing great. HUD is pretty bad.
